channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: S$^2$AC: Energy-Based Reinforcement Learning with Stein Soft Actor Critic
item.description: We derive a closed-form expression of the entropy of such policies.

item.title: Deep Learning Models in Speech Recognition: Measuring GPU Energy Consumption, Impact of Noise and Model Quantization for Edge Deployment
item.description: By analyzing WER and transcription speed across models using FP32, FP16, and INT8 quantization on clean and noisy datasets, we highlight the crucial trade-offs between accuracy, speeds, quantization, energy efficiency, and memory needs.

item.title: Test-time Assessment of a Model's Performance on Unseen Domains via Optimal Transport
item.description: Concretely, our metric characterizes the model's performance on unseen domains using only a small amount of unlabeled data from these domains and data or statistics from the training (source) domain(s).

item.title: Boosting Jailbreak Attack with Momentum
item.description: Recently, the Greedy Coordinate Gradient (GCG) attack has demonstrated efficacy in exploiting this vulnerability by optimizing adversarial prompts through a combination of gradient heuristics and greedy search.

item.title: The Importance of Model Inspection for Better Understanding Performance Characteristics of Graph Neural Networks
item.description: This study highlights the importance of conducting comprehensive model inspection as part of comparative performance analyses.

item.title: D2PO: Discriminator-Guided DPO with Response Evaluation Models
item.description: Varied approaches for aligning language models have been proposed, including supervised fine-tuning, RLHF, and direct optimization methods such as DPO.

item.title: FeNNol: an Efficient and Flexible Library for Building Force-field-enhanced Neural Network Potentials
item.description: Neural network interatomic potentials (NNPs) have recently proven to be powerful tools to accurately model complex molecular systems while bypassing the high numerical cost of ab-initio molecular dynamics simulations.

item.title: The Power of Question Translation Training in Multilingual Reasoning: Broadened Scope and Deepened Insights
item.description: In this paper, we explore how broadly this method can be applied by examining its effects in reasoning with executable code and reasoning with common sense.

item.title: Generative Relevance Feedback and Convergence of Adaptive Re-Ranking: University of Glasgow Terrier Team at TREC DL 2023
item.description: In re-ranking, we investigate operating points of adaptive re-ranking with different first stages to find the point in graph traversal where the first stage no longer has an effect on the performance of the overall retrieval pipeline.

item.title: Topics in the Study of the Pragmatic Functions of Phonetic Reduction in Dialog
item.description: Reduced articulatory precision is common in speech, but for dialog its acoustic properties and pragmatic functions have been little studied.

item.title: Lipschitz constant estimation for general neural network architectures using control tools
item.description: This paper is devoted to the estimation of the Lipschitz constant of neural networks using semidefinite programming.

item.title: Purify Unlearnable Examples via Rate-Constrained Variational Autoencoders
item.description: Based on this network, a two-stage purification approach is naturally developed.

item.title: Prometheus 2: An Open Source Language Model Specialized in Evaluating Other Language Models
item.description: Proprietary LMs such as GPT-4 are often employed to assess the quality of responses from various LMs.

item.title: MVMoE: Multi-Task Vehicle Routing Solver with Mixture-of-Experts
item.description: In this paper, we aim to develop a unified neural solver that can cope with a range of VRP variants simultaneously.

item.title: Creative Problem Solving in Large Language and Vision Models -- What Would it Take?
item.description: In this paper, we discuss approaches for integrating Computational Creativity (CC) with research in large language and vision models (LLVMs) to address a key limitation of these models, i. e., creative problem solving.

item.title: SynFlowNet: Towards Molecule Design with Guaranteed Synthesis Pathways
item.description: Recent breakthroughs in generative modelling have led to a number of works proposing molecular generation models for drug discovery.

item.title: Leveraging Procedural Generation for Learning Autonomous Peg-in-Hole Assembly in Space
item.description: We demonstrate the adaptability of our agents to novel scenarios and assembly sequences while emphasizing the potential of leveraging advanced simulation techniques for robot learning in space.

item.title: PLAID SHIRTTT for Large-Scale Streaming Dense Retrieval
item.description: PLAID, an efficient implementation of the ColBERT late interaction bi-encoder using pretrained language models for ranking, consistently achieves state-of-the-art performance in monolingual, cross-language, and multilingual retrieval.

item.title: LocInv: Localization-aware Inversion for Text-Guided Image Editing
item.description: Large-scale Text-to-Image (T2I) diffusion models demonstrate significant generation capabilities based on textual prompts.

item.title: The Privacy Power of Correlated Noise in Decentralized Learning
item.description: Decentralized learning is appealing as it enables the scalable usage of large amounts of distributed data and resources (without resorting to any central entity), while promoting privacy since every user minimizes the direct exposure of their data.

item.title: Spider: A Unified Framework for Context-dependent Concept Understanding
item.description: Different from the context-independent (CI) concepts such as human, car, and airplane, context-dependent (CD) concepts require higher visual understanding ability, such as camouflaged object and medical lesion.

item.title: Fair Recommendations with Limited Sensitive Attributes: A Distributionally Robust Optimization Approach
item.description: To this end, we propose Distributionally Robust Fair Optimization (DRFO), which minimizes the worst-case unfairness over all potential probability distributions of missing sensitive attributes instead of the reconstructed one to account for the impact of the reconstruction errors.

item.title: MiniGPT-3D: Efficiently Aligning 3D Point Clouds with Large Language Models using 2D Priors
item.description: Notably, MiniGPT-3D gains an 8. 12 increase on GPT-4 evaluation score for the challenging object captioning task compared to ShapeLLM-13B, while the latter costs 160 total GPU-hours on 8 A800.

item.title: Accelerating Convergence in Bayesian Few-Shot Classification
item.description: Bayesian few-shot classification has been a focal point in the field of few-shot learning.

item.title: Language Fairness in Multilingual Information Retrieval
item.description: We also evaluate real MLIR systems on two publicly available benchmarks and show that the PEER scores align with prior analytical findings on MLIR fairness.

item.title: Distillation for Multilingual Information Retrieval
item.description: Recent work in cross-language information retrieval (CLIR), where queries and documents are in different languages, has shown the benefit of the Translate-Distill framework that trains a cross-language neural dual-encoder model using translation and distillation.

item.title: Faster Learned Sparse Retrieval with Block-Max Pruning
item.description: Learned sparse retrieval systems aim to combine the effectiveness of contextualized language models with the scalability of conventional data structures such as inverted indexes.

item.title: A text-based, generative deep learning model for soil reflectance spectrum simulation in the VIS-NIR (400-2499 nm) bands
item.description: To address this, a fully data-driven soil optics generative model (SOGM) for simulation of soil reflectance spectra based on soil property inputs was developed.

item.title: Modeling Activity-Driven Music Listening with PACE
item.description: While the topic of listening context is widely studied in the literature of music recommender systems, the integration of regular user behavior is often omitted.

item.title: RaffeSDG: Random Frequency Filtering enabled Single-source Domain Generalization for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: To tackle domain shifts in data-scarce medical scenarios, we propose a Random frequency filtering enabled Single-source Domain Generalization algorithm (RaffeSDG), which promises robust out-of-domain inference with segmentation models trained on a single-source domain.

item.title: ATOM: Attention Mixer for Efficient Dataset Distillation
item.description: To address these challenges in dataset distillation, we propose the ATtentiOn Mixer (ATOM) module to efficiently distill large datasets using a mixture of channel and spatial-wise attention in the feature matching process.

item.title: Random Pareto front surfaces
item.description: As a motivating example, we investigate how these statistics can be used within a design of experiments setting, where the goal is to both infer and use the Pareto front surface distribution in order to make effective decisions.

item.title: Towards Consistent Object Detection via LiDAR-Camera Synergy
item.description: In light of this, this paper introduces an end-to-end Consistency Object Detection (COD) algorithm framework that requires only a single forward inference to simultaneously obtain an object's position in both point clouds and images and establish their correlation.

item.title: NeMo-Aligner: Scalable Toolkit for Efficient Model Alignment
item.description: However, building efficient tools to perform alignment can be challenging, especially for the largest and most competent LLMs which often contain tens or hundreds of billions of parameters.

item.title: Community-Invariant Graph Contrastive Learning
item.description: Graph augmentation has received great attention in recent years for graph contrastive learning (GCL) to learn well-generalized node/graph representations.

item.title: MFDS-Net: Multi-Scale Feature Depth-Supervised Network for Remote Sensing Change Detection with Global Semantic and Detail Information
item.description: We propose MFDS-Net: Multi-Scale Feature Depth-Supervised Network for Remote Sensing Change Detection with Global Semantic and Detail Information (MFDS-Net) with the aim of achieving a more refined description of changing buildings as well as geographic information, enhancing the localisation of changing targets and the acquisition of weak features.

item.title: Benchmarking Representations for Speech, Music, and Acoustic Events
item.description: Limited diversity in standardized benchmarks for evaluating audio representation learning (ARL) methods may hinder systematic comparison of current methods' capabilities.

item.title: UQA: Corpus for Urdu Question Answering
item.description: This paper introduces UQA, a novel dataset for question answering and text comprehension in Urdu, a low-resource language with over 70 million native speakers.

item.title: Lying Graph Convolution: Learning to Lie for Node Classification Tasks
item.description: In this paper, we introduce Lying-GCN, a new DGN inspired by opinion dynamics that can adaptively work in both the heterophilic and the homophilic setting.

item.title: DMON: A Simple yet Effective Approach for Argument Structure Learning
item.description: Argument structure learning~(ASL) entails predicting relations between arguments.

item.title: Imagine2touch: Predictive Tactile Sensing for Robotic Manipulation using Efficient Low-Dimensional Signals
item.description: We train Imagine2touch on two out of those shapes and validate it on the ood.

item.title: Analyzing the Role of Semantic Representations in the Era of Large Language Models
item.description: We find that it is difficult to predict which input examples AMR may help or hurt on, but errors tend to arise with multi-word expressions, named entities, and in the final inference step where the LLM must connect its reasoning over the AMR to its prediction.

item.title: Correcting Biased Centered Kernel Alignment Measures in Biological and Artificial Neural Networks
item.description: Using fMRI and MEG data from the THINGS project, we show that if biased CKA is applied to representations of different sizes in the low-data high-dimensionality domain, they are not directly comparable due to biased CKA's sensitivity to differing feature-sample ratios and not stimuli-driven responses.

item.title: Koopman Data-Driven Predictive Control with Robust Stability and Recursive Feasibility Guarantees
item.description: In this paper, we consider the design of data-driven predictive controllers for nonlinear systems from input-output data via linear-in-control input Koopman lifted models.

item.title: Less is More: on the Over-Globalizing Problem in Graph Transformers
item.description: Then we propose a novel Bi-Level Global Graph Transformer with Collaborative Training (CoBFormer), including the inter-cluster and intra-cluster Transformers, to prevent the over-globalizing problem while keeping the ability to extract valuable information from distant nodes.

item.title: StoryDiffusion: Consistent Self-Attention for Long-Range Image and Video Generation
item.description: This module converts the generated sequence of images into videos with smooth transitions and consistent subjects that are significantly more stable than the modules based on latent spaces only, especially in the context of long video generation.

item.title: Multi-intent-aware Session-based Recommendation
item.description: Session-based recommendation (SBR) aims to predict the following item a user will interact with during an ongoing session.

item.title: SparseTSF: Modeling Long-term Time Series Forecasting with 1k Parameters
item.description: This paper introduces SparseTSF, a novel, extremely lightweight model for Long-term Time Series Forecasting (LTSF), designed to address the challenges of modeling complex temporal dependencies over extended horizons with minimal computational resources.

item.title: Technical Report of NICE Challenge at CVPR 2024: Caption Re-ranking Evaluation Using Ensembled CLIP and Consensus Scores
item.description: This report presents the ECO (Ensembled Clip score and cOnsensus score) pipeline from team DSBA LAB, which is a new framework used to evaluate and rank captions for a given image.

item.title: Adaptive Bidirectional Displacement for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Consistency learning is a central strategy to tackle unlabeled data in semi-supervised medical image segmentation (SSMIS), which enforces the model to produce consistent predictions under the perturbation.
